body.name: Noctua NF-A4x20 PWM, Premium Quiet Fan for Server, 4-Pin (40x20mm, Brown)
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Saturday, February 17 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Friday, February 16. Order within 1 hr 5 mins
features: Premium quiet fan, 40x40x20 mm, 12V, 4-pin PWM, max. 5000 RPM, max. 14.9 dB(A), >150,000 h MTTF
Award-winning A-series design with Flow Acceleration Channels and Advanced Acoustic Optimisation frame for superior quiet cooling performance
40x20mm size ideal for 1U servers or replacing fans in network and storage equipment (routers, switches, NAS etc.) or other devices such as DVRs
4-pin PWM version for automatic speed control via 4-pin PWM fan headers, 5000rpm maximum speed (4400rpm with supplied Low-Noise Adaptor)
Includes anti-vibration mounts, fan screws, extension cable, y-cable and OmniJoin adaptor set for connecting the fan to proprietary fan headers

productInformation.name: Customer Reviews
productInformation.value: 4.8 4.8 out of 5 stars 1,666 ratings 4.8 out of 5 stars

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Featuring advanced aerodynamic design measures such as Flow Acceleration Channels and Noctua’s AAO frame, the NF-A4x20 is a highly optimised, premium-quality quiet fan in size 40x20mm. The PWM version sports Noctua’s custom-designed NE-FD1 IC for fully automatic speed control via 4-pin fan headers and comes with a Low-Noise Adaptor as well as an OmniJoin Adaptor Set for easy connection to proprietary fan headers. Its superb running smoothness, reference-class SSO2 bearing and Noctua’s trusted premium quality make it an elite choice for the highest demands.

40x20mm size Compared to Noctua’s award-winning NF-A4x10, the NF-A4x20 is twice as thick, which allows for increased static pressure performance and makes the NF-A4x20 ideal for demanding applications with high flow resistance.

Flow Acceleration Channels The NF-A4x20 impeller features suction side Flow Acceleration Channels. By speeding up the airflow at the crucial outer blade regions, this measure reduces suction side flow separation and thus leads to better efficiency and lower vortex noise. SSO2 Bearing The NF-A4x20 features the further optimised second generation of Noctua's renowned, time-tested SSO bearing. With SSO2, the rear magnet is placed closer to the axis to provide even better stabilisation, precision and durability. Integrated Anti-Vibration Pads Integrated Anti-Vibration Pads made from extra-soft silicone minimise the transmission of minute vibrations while maintaining full compatibility with all standard mounting systems and fan clips used on heatsinks. Scope of delivery NA-RC7 Low-Noise Adaptor (L.N.A)NA-YC1 4-pin PWM y-cableNA-EC1 30cm extension cableOmniJoin adaptor set4x NA-AV3 anti-vibration mountsFan screws

AAO frame Noctua's AAO (Advanced Acoustic Optimisation) frames feature integrated anti-vibration pads as well as Noctua's proprietary Stepped Inlet Design and Inner Surface Microstructures, both of which further refine the fan's performance/noise efficiency.

NF-A4x20 PWM NF-A4x20 FLX NF-A4x20 5V PWM NF-A4x20 5V Connector 4-pin PWM 3-pin 4-pin PWM 3-pin Voltage 12V 12V 5V 5V RPM Max: 5000 / Min: 1200 5000 Max: 5000 / Min: 1100 5000 RPM with L.N.A. 4400 4400 - - RPM with U.L.N.A. - 3700 - - Acoustical Noise 14,9 dB(A) 14,9 dB(A) 14,9 dB(A) 14,9 dB(A) Acoustical Noise with L.N.A. 12,2 dB(A) 12,2 dB(A) - - Acoustical Noise with U.L.N.A. - 8,5 dB(A) - - Size 40x40x20 mm 40x40x20 mm 40x40x20 mm 40x40x20 mm Colour Brown & Beige Brown & Beige Brown & Beige Brown & Beige

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Unrivaled Performance in a Compact Package!
reviews.reviewText: I recently added the Noctua NF-A4x20 PWM to my server setup, and the performance of this 40x20mm fan has left me thoroughly impressed. Noctua's reputation for premium quality is well-deserved, and this fan is no exception.Firstly, the build quality is exceptional. The brown color may be unconventional, but it's a symbol of Noctua's commitment to quality. The construction feels robust, and the attention to detail is evident. This fan exudes durability, assuring me that it can handle continuous operation in a server environment.Now, let's talk about the noise level—or rather, the lack of it. This fan is remarkably quiet, especially considering its size. Noctua's focus on providing a quiet solution without sacrificing performance is evident here. Whether my server is working at full capacity or idling, the NF-A4x20 PWM operates silently, contributing to a peaceful and distraction-free environment.The PWM functionality is a standout feature. The fan's speed is dynamically controlled based on the system's temperature needs, ensuring optimal cooling without unnecessary noise. This adaptability is a game-changer for maintaining the right balance between temperature control and acoustics.Installation was a breeze, thanks to the included accessories and clear instructions. The fan integrates seamlessly into my server setup, and the 4-pin connector allows for precise control over its operation.The performance, reliability, and quiet operation make it a top-tier choice for anyone seeking a compact, high-quality fan for their server. In my book, it's a solid 5-star product, and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to anyone looking to add performance and lower the noise level of their server or PC.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Whisper quiet, decent airflow
reviews.reviewText: These are not Delta fans. I have 3 of these installed inside a Netgear XS505M 5-port 10GbE switch. Individually they do not move as much air as the OEM Foxconn fan that shipped with the switch. They also do not have the horrific 20Khz-ish shriek that just drills itself into your subconscious when you're not looking. And 3 of them do move enough air to keep my switch cool. Because they spin slower than the OEM fan, the switch DOES throw a fan-fail light. I have not had any drops in performance though, or overheating.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great fan from a great brand
reviews.reviewText: I got a decommissioned server that was a little too loud for me. I added some extra fans to the CPU sinks and the raid controller, and Noctua was an obvious choice. I added this fan to the RAID controller, and it's kept both the noise and the temperature down nicely. You get what you pay for friends, Noctua is the way to go.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Silence is golden
reviews.reviewText: These don't move as much air as the fans they replaced. I read another reviewer that said the point of these is so that you don't have something that sounds like a terminator moving. Very accurate, and is what made me purchase. I don't care about the less air flow, because it is located close to people, so the temperature will be pretty steady and reasonable. I can not hear any noise at all unless I get within 2-3 feet of it, and even with my ear right next to the fan, it is very quiet.I wish that they labeled the cables somewhere. I had to swap 2 of them, but it was a little trial and error. Having a diagram of what each color is (power, ground, pcm, rpm) would have been nice. It was nice that they included some splice connectors to make the job easy.I would prefer less packaging. This was a retail type package and looked very pretty, but for a drop ship item, it isn't needed.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 8, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Swapped fans for 3560 Cisco Switch - IMPRESSED
reviews.reviewText: First, I want to start by saying that I was SUPER impressed when opening these noctua fans. They have everything you could need in the box. I really appreciated that.When I tried to go directly into the fan jacks onto the Cisco switch, the fans would not spin, and I smelled a bad smell. Fortunately, it doesn't seem I ruined anything.Luckily, Noctua in their wisdom, included an adapter, with a red & black wire coming off. I snipped off the jack from the original Cisco fans, and spliced the wires, red -> red, black -> black. I left yellow unconnected, and cut it short to keep it out of the way. Wrapped the connections in some electrical tape, of course.Bam, they worked when I plugged them in. They are not the exact same size as the original fans, but definitely close enough to work fine.Swapped out all three Cisco oem fans and they are completely quiet now. I can't hear a thing.10/10 would recommend.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 18, 2023
reviews.reviewText: The fan itself works and does not produce noise. However the packaging is excessive. The fan itself takes very little space while it is contained in a large fan box with folding pages. This is very unnecessary because usually people would buy these in bulk. This can be very wasteful.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 6, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Noctua needs to make these fans in black, but you can dye these black
reviews.reviewText: Great fans, but absolutely revolting color scheme. I managed to dye these almost completely black using RIT Dye More synthetic dye graphite color (the regular RIT dyes did not work for me). Used the whole bottle of dye and just enough boiling water to keep the fans I was dying covered, kept at almost boiling for an hour, washed them with clean water, and then dried them over night. Fans still work great, but they still have a very slight hint of brown color. I may try again using a the synthetic blue or just more dye to make them darker, but unless you look at them under bright light you would say they are black. Noctua I will pay a few $ more if you just make these in black so that I don't have to make a mess with dye.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars This is a premium fan
reviews.reviewText: Replaced 3 fans in a 1U server case with these Noctuas, and they’re so good I could have the box operating in a bedroom. Super quiet and keep the whole thing cool, including a 4 port 10G fiber NIC. Well worth the money.

reviews.reviewTitle: Noctua is the pinnacle of quality, elegance, and product support
reviews.reviewText: The fan is so quiet, it’s impossible to hear anything. The fan is built super well, and comes with a variety of various connection.I was very pleasantly surprised that Noctua even included an adapter that I exactly would have wanted, which converts the connector to a red and black wire for soldering which is what I needed for my Ender 3. I was so impressed.Comes with all kinds of things in really nice packaging.This was an exceptional product experience. Up there among the very best. Noctua is top notch. I’ll be buying my fans exclusively from them from now on.

Calidad Noctua. Para una fuente de poder ITX buscaba un ventilador con alto rendimiento y muy silencioso y Noctua es el ganador. En cuanto a presentacion desde el empaque notas la calidad premium de los materiales, la variedad de accesorios incluidos, la calidad del cable... En cuanto a rendimiento practicamente es imperceptible el ruido para la cantidad de aire que genera. Comparandolo con un Nidec no tiene nada que hacer el noctua, pero Nidec hace ruido y vibra como un mototool, aun a bajas RPM, en entornos industriales donde no importa el ruido Nidec es superior pues tiene mayor rendimiento ya que gira a mas altas RPM, Pero esque el noctua al 100% hace menos ruido que el Nidec al minimo que deja el PWM y no vibra nada, a similares RPM mueven el mismo aire, pero Noctua no se escucha nada, y nidec pues parece un mini taladro. Ni hablar, Noctua no tiene rival en relacion Rendimiento-Silencio.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on September 17, 2021
reviews.reviewText: Ticks every box and is brilliant value for money
Replaced the fan in my Aruba InstantOn switch with this. Went from excessive noise to near silence.

Adding adding 10G copper transceivers, the stock fans were unbearably whiny because the copper transceivers run crazy hot. I swapped the stock fans to these and now all I get is peace and tranquility.
